data.title: Analysis Of Woody Harrelson - 945 Words
data.meta_description: 18. Woody Harrelson. He portrayed Woody Boyd in the 1985 television sitcom Cheers, and also played Haymitch Abernathy for The Hunger Games series. But...
data.text:
18. Woody Harrelson. He portrayed Woody Boyd in the 1985 television sitcom Cheers, and also played Haymitch Abernathy for The Hunger Games series. But Harrelson has his own fair share of scandals as well that shattered our faith in humanity. In 1982, prior to his breakthrough in Cheers, Harrelson was arrested for disorderly conduct when he was seen dancing mid-street. He also has a record of resisting arrest, yet he was able to bail out himself from it and avoided jail. 19. Marilyn Manson. He may have created a hug name for himself in the music industry, but he was also charged with sexual misconduct. The charge was filed by a security officer after allegedly accused of rubbing his crotch on the officer's head. Manson was charged with misdemeanor …show more content…

Josh Duggar. Yes, he is a famous television personality and a political activist on top of being an ex-executive director of a non-profit organization sponsored by the Family Research Council. But Duggar may now be one of the most hated persons in America after it was found out that he molested five girls between the age 14 and 15. This includes four of his sisters... now that's shattering humanity. 29. Danny Trejo. Being an action star as he is, there is no surprise that Trejo is involved in drugs, murder and robbery. The only problem is the fact that he is really the bad guy here. In reality, he is a genuine thug and was sentenced to spend 11 years in prison for a lot of mischief including drugs, murder and robbery. But despite being the thug that he was, Trejo had no reports of mischief after his incarceration and released. 30. Robert Blake. The veteran actor has been charged in 2002 with the murder of his wife. Though he did not do it personally, the prosecution claimed he asked some stuntmen to do the killing for him. Since he could not be tied strongly to the incident, he was acquitted. But in 2005, his wife's three children filed a civil suit against him with the same claims of murder and he was charged liable and has to pay $30
